description: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) has a requirement for the provision of Ergonomic Office Chairs to meet the demand of office workers. A contract will be awarded for the purchase, delivery and installation of office seating.
full_summary:
=====================================

## Government Tender Announcement

The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) invites qualified suppliers to submit a tender for the provision of Ergonomic Office Chairs. The contract will be awarded to the supplier offering the highest value to the CFIA, while meeting the specified requirements.

**Reference Details**
----------------------

* Tender Identification: CB-4921-67385154
* Solicitation Number: 2023-01146
* Amendment Number: 1
* Tender Status: Expired
* Publication Date: April 19, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: May 2, 2023, at 14:00

**Procurement Information**
---------------------------

* Procurement Method: Competitive – Selective Tendering
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price
* Trade Agreements: Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, and Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Regions of Opportunity: Canada
* Regions of Delivery: National Capital Region (NCR)

**Contract Details**
--------------------

* Contracting Entity: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA)
* Contracting Entity Address: 59 Camelot Dr., Nepean, ON K2G 5W6, Canada
* End User Entities: CFIA
* Contact Information:
  - Name: Catherine Clairoux
  - Email: catherine.clairoux@inspection.gc.ca
  - Phone: (343) 596-9265

**Tender Documentation**
-------------------------

Please refer to the attached documents for tender details.

* Tender Notice: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/4921/2023-01146-rfp.pdf
* Non-Publication Proceedings: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/4921/2023-01146-npp.pdf

Note:
Only include the latest official tender details (unless a previous tender has been clearly referenced) to avoid inaccuracies.
The supply arrangements belong to the contracting agency. Ensure that the contractor doesn't misrepresent any information from the agency.
Only provide characteristic summaries (when a traditional trade agreement isn't used in the bid handling procedures) when there are relevant details needed to be referenced. In other words, avoid providing the entire list of characteristic summaries. You can explicitly mention
